III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has been sexually abused three times with one of the
incidents occurring by another youth at the facility. Details are
unknown.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor/Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on
May 31, 2023. Supervisor reported Youth A disclosed they were
sexually abused three different times and was frustrated no one
was believing them. It was reported one of the assaults may have
been with Youth B which Supervisor does not know if that was a
situation that occurred at school on April 11, 2023, or not. The
supervisor reported he did not ask Youth A any more questions.
Supervisor reported Youth B is no longer at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 1,
2023. Youth A reported they have been getting frustrated with the
youth at the facility as they do not believe them about Youth B
sexually assaulting them. They reported since Youth B left the
facility, they are getting some pushback from the other youth and
that is why they yelled out the other day about frustrations of no
one believing them of the sexual assaults. Youth A reported the
sexual assault that occurred with Youth B happened at the off-
campus school back in April. They got frustrated with this
consultant as they have already spoken to this consultant about
this. Youth A reported after the school incident occurred, staff put
them on a Peer Boundary Safety plan and moved Youth B to a
different home. They reported staff do a good job at supervision
and that is why there was never a sexual assault that occurred at
the facility or when staff were supervising them. Youth A reported
the other sexual assaults occurred prior to their stay at the facility
and they have dealt with law enforcement about it. Youth A was
very adamant that they did not want to speak with law
enforcement or move forward with any charges. They reported
they are frustrated with the whole system and just wanted to be
left alone. Youth A reported the only person they trust talking
about this with is their mother.
2

Youth B was interviewed face to face at another facility on
May 31, 2023. Youth B reported he was previously in a
relationship with Youth A because they were going to off-site
schooling together. He reported Youth A got upset with him
because he turned over their contraband of a cell phone and
telling staff that Youth A had a vape. Youth B reported they got
caught by school staff in the bathroom together at school, which
was reported to the facility. He reported he did not want to talk
about if there were sexual acts that occurred at school but
reported if anything did happen Youth A was the one encouraging
it. Youth B reported when the facility found out he got put on peer
boundaries status, meaning he had heightened supervision, and
had to move to another home on campus. Youth B reported there
was no other time he had a sexual relationship with Youth A
besides the one time at school. He reported they never had sexual
acts at the facility or when they were under the facility staff's
supervision. Youth B reported staff at the facility are on top of
supervising the youth and he would not be able to get away with
that if he wanted to. He reported Youth A is mad at him for
reporting their contraband and feels he got their parent in trouble
from the last investigation.
Therapist and Case Manager were interviewed face to face
separately at the facility on May 31, 2023. Therapist and Case
Manager are both assigned to work with Youth A while they are
placed at the facility. Youth A has reported to both Therapist and
Case Manager about being sexually assaulted previously by their
father. Therapist and Case Manager both reported that sexual
assault was called into CPS to be investigated prior and Youth A
refused to speak to law enforcement. Therapist and Case
Manager reported in April 2023, Youth A and Youth B were caught
at the off-grounds school together in the bathroom with concerns
of sexual activity occurring between them. It was reported Youth A
and Youth B may have been in a relationship with one another
during that time. Youth A at first refused to talk about it to either
Therapist or Case Manager. Youth A later reported Youth B had
sexually assaulted them at school and this was reported to CPS
and Law Enforcement. At that time, Youth A refused to talk to law
enforcement. After the incident was reported from school, Youth A
and Youth B were put on peer boundaries safety plan and Youth B
moved to the other home on campus. Therapist and Case
Manager reported Youth A has brought concerns about doing
sexual favors to get contraband but that was investigated prior in
April 2023 (Investigation #2023C0000402). Youth A has been
offered to call law enforcement any time when they bring these
concerns up to both Therapist and Case Manager. There has
3

never been a report of sexual assault occurring at the facility or
when Youth A is being supervised by staff. The reported sexual
assault concerns were reported to take place at off grounds
school or before Youth A was placed at the facility. Therapist and
Case Manager both have been involved with the school in reports
to this concern.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the
facility on May 31, 2023. Chief Administrator reported on April
11, 2023, the facility received a call from Youth A and Youth B’s
off-grounds school reporting concerns of sexual activity occurring
in the school’s bathroom with both youths. It was reported Youth A
and Youth B appeared to be dating one another. Once this
information was received, a Peer Boundaries Safety plan was
completed with both youth which increased the supervision level
for both youths. Chief Administrator reported Youth B was moved
to the other house on campus and later discharged from the
facility on 05/19/2023.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed face to face separately at
the facility on June 1, 2023. Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported the only
sexual assault incident they were aware of was the incident that
occurred with Youth A and Youth B at an off-ground school in
April. When that report came through the facility notified the staff
immediately for heightened supervision and proceeded to move
Youth B to another house. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were knowledgeable
of the peer boundary safety plan. They both reported Youth A has
a history of sexual abuse and concerns about prostitution. Staff 1
reported since Youth B left the facility Youth A has been getting
into arguments with other peers in the house about their
relationship with Youth B. Staff 1 reported these situations are
being redirected and addressed with the peers involved.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Youth Supervision Procedure with the most
recent revision date of June 2022- Staff are responsible
for the direct supervision of youth living in the house in
which they are working. To ensure appropriate supervision,
staff responsible for youth must: maintain visual contact
and monitoring of the youth; know where each youth is at
all times; be physically present in close proximity to the
youth; clearly communicate when the supervision of youth
transfers to another staff person; ensure hallways are being
monitored at all times when youth are in their rooms, den,
bathrooms, laundry room, common hallway space or med
cart area. If a staff member must leave their post as direct
4

supervisor of the hallway, they will notify another staff to
take over this supervision.
- Facility Incident report dated April 11, 2023 at 7pm-
Staff received a call from the local off ground high school
reported Youth A and Youth B have been suspended from
school due not being where they were supposed to be
during school hours. School reported after reviewing
camera footage, it was found that Youth A and Youth B
entered the unisex bathroom and spent about 7 minutes in
the unisex bathroom. Youth A and Youth B exited
separately, Youth B walked into the men’s bathroom and
exited after spending a short period of time before returning
back to where he was supposed to be during school. The
information was relayed to the Therapist and Chief
Administrator which led to the Peer Boundaries plan being
put in place first thing the next morning.
- Youth A’s Peer Boundaries form dated April 12, 2023-
This form was completed due to a peer boundary issue with
Youth B at school 04/11/2023. Staff must be between
Youth A and peers at all times. Youth A must be in line of
sight when in the milieu.
- Email from Law Enforcement dated May 31, 2023- “Law
Enforcement will not be assigned for further investigation at
this time as this has been previously investigated with the
parties involved. There was no concerning evidence found
and Youth A refused to speak with Law Enforcement.”
Analysis The facility is compliance of following their internal supervision
policy. The reported sexual assault that occurred between Youth
A and Youth B was reported to have taken place at office site
school that is not under staff supervision. When the facility was
made known of the situation, the facility put into effect a peer-
boundaries safety plan and moved Youth B into another home to
make sure there was proper supervision taking place.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
